website_summaries.verdict: A compact, affordable piece of equipment that retains solid build quality.
pros: A lightweight yet sturdy tool to strengthen the lower back, glutes, and abdominals
Features a stable wide base and impressive vertical and horizontal adjustments
Height can be raised from 23.5 inches to 28.7 inches
cons: The assembly instructions could be clearer

website_summaries.verdict: This back machine boasts a heavy-duty frame that's best for those who are taller.
pros: Sturdy frame that comfortably supports individuals of above-average height
Entire machine appears very durable and built to last
cons: May take some time to set up
Nearly unusable for anyone under five foot four

customer_reviews.title: So exctied to use!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'4 bought this put this together and found I can fit comfortably if I locked myself in but I couldn't reach the ground. I could reach the ground however when I just took the pin out and let it go down all the way. So if your under 5'4 I wouldn't get this unless you feel physical capable of holding yourself up a little. If your 5'4 and over then your going to have no problems. Should also note my 215 lbs dad used this and felt completely safe. Easy set up too, all you need is two wrenches.
customer_reviews.author: Cait

customer_reviews.title: Slowly equals stability.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I’m 5’7, 215lbs, I use the rearmost setting on the ankle bar and a pillow under my stomach and I hang freely forward and my arms just past the wrists are on the floor. I’ve read a review about it being wobbly; I think they were moving way too fast. I rise very slowly to full extension, pause and slowly release back to a hang. It is very stable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Quality, but not for people less than 5'6
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'6 and this fits perfectly on the lowest setting. It allows me to rest my toes on the base and gits perfectly on the top of my thighs. I would like it a little bit lower (maybe an inch or two) but for this price it does the trick. It folds nicely and is sturdy. I would not recommend this for anyone shorter than am unless you are willing to drill more holes so that the the tube with pad can be lowered even more. If concerned, this bench is quality!
customer_reviews.author: Dbs0003

customer_reviews.title: Very good, sturdy and well built for a guy my ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good, sturdy and well built for a guy my stature, 170lbs 6"2. Reading the reviews gives you a sense that this is cheaply built, there is even some photos of bent steel, these must be immense pressures to be able to bend this.
customer_reviews.author: zauts

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy - Easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.text: Love this at the gym but cancelled my membership. Found this as a very reasonably priced home option. It really works great for strengthening my core and I can use it at home. Folds up nicely out of the way and is easy to put up and take down. Very sturdy. I am 5'4" and It is great for me.
customer_reviews.author: alli

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, terrible assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled, I'm pretty happy with this. Good design and fair build quality. But there were, in effect, no assembly instructions. There was simply an exploded diagram with number-labeled parts. It's not overly complicated, and I got it together with only one or two mistakes, but it was pretty ridiculous to have to sit and measure the different bolts and figure out which numbers they correspond to on the diagram.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID WILCOX

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Does it’s putpose. But agree with other reviews, the quality is not great. Has a slight wobble and a weird spot if you want to work your side crunches, your feet don’t fit. I am 5’4 and have to move all the way down to fit.
customer_reviews.author: christina m

customer_reviews.title: Defective items
customer_reviews.text: Metal pieces were unable to fit together, like it was haphazardly and improperly made via factory. Unable to even use, metal pieces too thick and it was absolutely not possible to bend this solid steel equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Best all around exercise bench!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Covers all the bases in terms of functions and whatnot. I didnt need the squat rack/bench press attachment because I prefer free weights to bars. Took a bit of time to assemble but the final product is strong and stable. I have it in my bedroom and fits nicely. I can sit up the back rest and move it out of the way when not in use. Can use both concrete weights and olympic weights thanks to the adapter! Going to buy some 25lb olympic weights for it so I dont have to take the ones off of my dumbbells.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Oganesyan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price. The only issue is the adjustment range. I have to have it adjusted to it's lowest setting to be able to use it due to my height. Minimum comfortable height for this bench would be about 5-4. Might end up modifying it to go lower for me. Otherwise I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: Ready to hyperextend! Yea!
customer_reviews.text: The bench is as described. It is sturdy for the weight ranges indicated. I'm happy with my purchase and the price I paid. It was missing one non essential part and another was broken on arrival. Neither part are integral as they are only plastic caps for the metal holes.
customer_reviews.author: barbies house

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Functionality
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for simply a bench to use with free weights when I found this bench. For the same price of a comparable bench-only, I have leg exercises and curling exercises built in. And while the number of parts necessary for assembly might be daunting, the instructions and the labeling of the components is very clear making the assembly reasonably easy. It did take me about two hours to assemble it. It feels very sturdy and I look forward to much use.
customer_reviews.author: nova nguyen

customer_reviews.title: some times when I am doing the workout it feels like it is loosing its balance
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't feel secure, some times when I am doing the workout it feels like it is loosing its balance.
customer_reviews.author: Erasmo Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price/ Cheap product
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price and a cheap product. Not worth the money. Buy a better one, have already gotten rid of this one and shopping for something better
customer_reviews.author: tom thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: There is a screw left. I can't put it where the instructions say it goes. Instructions could also use more clarity. The are different screw sizes and just one image where it says where everything goes. Screws are not lab though. I have it a 4 because it's totally worth it for the price
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Not good if under 5'5" I am 5'4" and had to ...
customer_reviews.text: Not good if under 5'5" I am 5'4" and had to stand on tippy toes to make it work
customer_reviews.author: Tanayiia J.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money, gives you what you need but does not feel safe to use with any kind of weights other than yourself, not very sturdy but i only use it for warmups which is perfect for the time being, 3 stars but would reccomend for budget gyms for sure
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband and he loves it, it feels comfortable for him at 5'10, he says it's helped him so much with developing his lower back and his abs, he says the only downgrade would be the assembly knowing where to put everything and having everything in the right spots so he wouldn't have to keep changing it over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy M

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is great!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! My dad is extremely tall and it was a little bit to small for him but I emailed them and they were very willing to help us out. Great customer service. We kept our item and are very happy with its quality
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey W.

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully this is returnable
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with cracked pieces, missing sturdy pin. Hopefully I can return
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Tall enough for a 6' person and sturdu
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pinc

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The nuts provided do not fit the bolts. Product is unable to be assembled. Junk/scam product.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Decent for price, but lacks some stability
customer_reviews.text: Decent product overall, but I found when I do hyper-extension abs, the back feet start to lift. I attribute it to the actual weight of the product, its quite light so it doesn't compound much weight resistance tipping the opposite direction.
customer_reviews.author: JohnJ

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to assemble, terrible directions and the pieces do not fit. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my home gym
customer_reviews.text: Very very happy with the chair. Solid. Compact. Nice price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Neumyer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little bench
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say how hard or easy this is to assemble as I paid someone to do it. But it’s a sturdy little bench.
customer_reviews.author: Lisamarie Benito

customer_reviews.title: Rocky
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty easy to put together but it is a little rocky which can be concerning when you are upside down. Good price and definitely usable!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'3... set at the lowest setting ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'3...set at the lowest setting, it was still too high for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to assemble. Returning it
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't able to assemble it. It has some bolts missing and it has a very confusing instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Over all good but......
customer_reviews.text: Good machine but if you are a guy you wanna get one that has a split in the top pad to eliminate pressure on your male parts if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble! Worked great for me, I use it for back extensions and rear felt shoulder exercises though i imagine I’ll discover other uses as well!
customer_reviews.author: Deezy

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use it quite a bit. Nice addition to my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Wiedholz

customer_reviews.title: Can't hold 200 lbs.
customer_reviews.text: If you weigh more than 200 lbs this product will not hold well, and you will have to make your own modifications to make it sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Good product really can get a good workout with this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble great workouts for abs and back. Love it. Price was great also
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Go plus Ab/back bench
customer_reviews.text: About bench went together very easily. Although it is not used very often, it serves it's purpose very well to really stretch and strengthen back muscles and work your core.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... does exactly what it's supposed to do and is great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it's supposed to do and is great for the price. It does collapse for storage, but is for people no shorter than about 5'6". I'm around 170 and it holds me fine.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Shopper

customer_reviews.title: look at pic for directions . For screws. Line them up from longest to shortes.
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was a adjustment for short people. It makes my stomach hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Shakasheznuts

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this but was a little to high for me but I am very short
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: No stars. Had it for a few weeks. Was good. But the main support bent. Im 180 and was doing BW hyoerextentions. And I cannot find the contact info.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Horrible instructions, cosmetic damages
customer_reviews.text: Overall not a bad product if you can figure out how to put it together with only looking at a very small diagram. The parts on the picture are number however the parts themselves aren't. Only giving 2 stars because I paid full price for it and received a damaged one....it still functions, despite its looks so I'll keep it and I don't want to take it apart to send it back. It's OK for the price but I wouldn't buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Mama Young

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Main support beam bent after 3 weeks. not usable. junk. Im not that heavy. I weigh 198lbs
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to be inconvenienced with time and money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get my hypertension chair today! After work i open the box and immediately organized my parts & pieces to begin putting it together. At first everything seemed ok until I got to the nuts for the long screws.......THEY DON'T FIT!!!!!!! I calmed down and called my friend over (he build homes for a living) and he confirmed the nuts didn't fit the long screws so we ended up going to home depot to have the screws fitted for the right nuts. If you're going to sell an item like this you need to do right by the customers and at least make sure you're putting the right parts in the box for assembly!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: robin

customer_reviews.title: The padding tends to dig into your pelvis more than I'd like.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it has held up. But it is fairly small, and the padding is kind of feeble. It get's the job done for a home gym but it makes the job of doing hyperextensions more unpleasant than it would be on a higher quality machine. The padding tends to dig into your pelvis more than I'd like.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S

customer_reviews.title: Seems like an unfinished design
customer_reviews.text: If I could give 3.5 instead of 4 stars, it would have received that. It lost the first star for the worst assembly instructions I have ever seen and it lost the second star because of the bolts that are longer than they should be but are restrained by their “M10 Nylon Nut”. This makes the foam pads where your legs are loose and unsecured, doesn’t instill much confidence when you’re upside down. It’s also not clear how this can be folded and stored. So close to having an excellent product. The metal is nice quality and the upper pad you rest your hips on is quite supportive. Hopefully my feedback will help them refine a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan A.

customer_reviews.title: Very resonably priced!  Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great especially for the price! Gets the job done and won’t break the bank!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Runyon

product_meta.title: Goplus Adjustable Roman Chair, Foldable Abdominal Exercise Bench Back Hyperextension Bench
product_meta.description:
This is our new hyperextension Bench, which makes work more effective, as well as adds strength and tone to the entire abdominal section. With ample padding and heavy duty steel construction, our sit up board provides stability for simple exercises and is ideal for you to more easily emphasize lower abdominal muscles and build the abs you want in less time. Welcome! High quality with competitive price can be realized here! 
Outer rectangular tube size: 50 x 50 x 1.5mm 
Inner rectangular tube size: 38x38x1.5mm 
Pad Thickness: 1.6’’ 
Size of the pad: 15.7" x 11"(L x W) 
Whole size: 23.5" x 18.9" x 39" (L x W x Max H) 
Package include: 1 x Hyperextension Bench (need assembled), 1 x Instruction 
Notes: 
1. Simple Assembly is required according to included instruction. 
2. Please warm up fully before training to avoid physical injury.
feature_bullets: 【Heavy-Duty Construction】 With heavy-duty steel construction and thickened steel pipe, the max weight capacity of this roman chair is 330lbs, which make it could be applied to more people. This back hyperextension bench is sturdy and gives optimal support when in training.

【Height Adjustable & Foldable Design】 With the height range from 28.7'' – 23.5'' (5 levels adjustable), it can be adjusted according to your height and meet the needs of different groups of people and other functional training.

【Versatile Function】 The training platform can be used for a variety of abdominal exercises such as goat back movement, sit-ups, push-ups, and lateral flexion. It also helps to build gluteus and hamstring muscles. Then you could achieve body workout at home.
【Humanization Design】 Pivoting foam rollers hold your lower leg in place for hyperextension exercises, and feet in place for crunches. A 1.5" wide pad protects your back and provides maximum comfort.
【Convenient Assembly & Storage】 The assembly of this Roman chair is very simple. Its compact design allows the user to conveniently store it in the corner with other sports equipment.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
